meanings.sent1: Tom tried to chouse his friend into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent2: She always chouses her way out of doing chores.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to chouse the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to chouse the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox used its cunning to chouse the farmer out of his dinner.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The chouse was known for his clever schemes.
meanings.sent2: Beware of that chouse; he cannot be trusted.
meanings.sent3: The little chouse managed to convince everyone he was a superhero.
meanings.sent4: She was a chouse in disguise, fooling everyone with her innocent smile.
meanings.sent5: The old chouse had a twinkle in his eye that hinted at his mischievous nature.
